resources.string: braille keyboard
TalkBack braille keyboard
Braille keyboard
Braille keyboard gestures
Switch to touch-screen keyboard
An external braille display is connected, which you can use to type text into this device.\nOr, you can switch to the touch-screen Braille Keyboard or the next input method.
Braille keyboard tutorial
There is no other keyboard enabled, go to keyboard settings
Couldn’t update dot position. Touch and hold the screen with 6 fingers. Then try again.
Dot position updated
Updating dot position. First, let’s record the dots on your left hand. Touch and hold the screen with the middle 3 fingers of your left hand.
Updating dot position. First, let’s record the dots on your right hand. Touch and hold the screen with the middle 3 fingers of your right hand.
Updated positions for dots 1, 2, and 3. Next, let’s record the dots on your left hand. Touch and hold the screen with the middle 3 fingers of your left hand.
Updated positions for dots 1, 2, and 3. Next, let’s record the dots on your right hand. Touch and hold the screen with the middle 3 fingers of your right hand.
Switch to next language: %s
Currently using: %s
Layout
Review all gestures
Settings
Braille keyboard options
Finish tutorial
Open tutorial
Let’s continue the tutorial. %1$s
Done
Don’t show this again
Showing braille keyboard. Turn your phone so the screen is facing away from you. Rotate the phone horizontally to landscape position. Then start typing.
Gboard
To add a space, swipe right
To delete, swipe left
To delete a word, swipe left with 2 fingers
To hide the keyboard, swipe down with 2 fingers
To move the cursor backward, swipe up
To move the cursor forward, swipe down
For a new line, swipe right with 2 fingers
To switch to the next keyboard, swipe down with 3 fingers
For help and other options, swipe up with 3 fingers
To submit text, swipe up with 2 fingers
%s\nPlace your device flat on a table. Then, touch and hold the screen with the middle 3 fingers of each hand in a position that’s comfortable for you to type.
You won’t be able to use regular TalkBack gestures in the braille keyboard.\n\nTo get started, let’s set up the position of the 6 braille dots when you type.
Place your device flat on a table. Then, touch and hold the screen with the middle 3 fingers of each hand in a position that’s comfortable for you to type.
How to use braille keyboard
TalkBack braille keyboard - for help, visit g.co/help/braille
To move the cursor forward, swipe down
To hide keyboard, swipe down with 2 fingers
To switch to your other keyboard, swipe down with 3 fingers
To delete a letter, swipe left
To add a space, swipe right
To move the cursor backward, swipe up
To finish tutorial, swipe up with 3 fingers
Tap dot 1 with your left index finger to type the letter "A"
Next, try typing the letters B, C, and D
Leave braille keyboard
braille keyboard, %s
Next keyboard
Next
Your device doesn’t support enough touch points. For more information, contact your device manufacturer.
Your device doesn’t support braille keyboard
The options menu is open. Flip your phone back so it’s facing you and hold it normally. You can now use regular TalkBack gestures to navigate. Swipe right to see more options.
Next
Submitting text
New line added

Letter deleted
Word deleted

Submit text

pref_brailleime_see_all_actions
pref_brailleime_turn_on_braille_keyboard

All dot positions updated
Swipe up with 3 fingers for more options
MOVED CURSOR FORWARD
HIDE KEYBOARD
NEXT KEYBOARD
DELETE
SPACE
MOVED CURSOR BACKWARD
Starting now, you won’t be able to use regular TalkBack gestures. TalkBack isn’t available while using the braille keyboard.\n\n%1$s

Your phone is in a vertical position. To continue, rotate your phone horizontally so the long side is on the bottom. Then turn the screen to face away from you. When you’re ready, double tap the screen to continue.
Starting now, you won’t be able to use regular TalkBack gestures. TalkBack isn’t available while using the braille keyboard.
To start, hold your phone like this, with the screen facing away from you.

First, turn your phone so the screen is facing away from you.

Next, rotate the phone horizontally to landscape position. Your hands should grip the short ends of the phone. Your right hand should hold the end with the USB port. Rest your 3 middle fingers on the screen, and use your pinky and thumb to support the phone.

When you’re ready, double tap the screen to continue.

To exit braille keyboard, swipe down toward the ground with 3 fingers. This switches back to your original keyboard.
Set up braille keyboard
Each pressed dot is part of the input, even if the dot is released before other dots
Swap the dot positions, so that dots 1 and 4 trade places, for example
To hide the keyboard, swipe down with 2 fingers. Try it now.
Hide keyboard. Usually, this will hide the keyboard. The braille keyboard will stay open because you’re still in the tutorial.
To switch to your other keyboard, swipe down with 3 fingers. Try it now.
Next keyboard. Usually, this will switch to the next keyboard. This time, you’re staying in the braille keyboard because you’re still in the tutorial.
To move the cursor forward, swipe down. Try it now.
d deleted.
To delete a letter, swipe left. Try it now.
To add a space, swipe right. Try it now.
You can also type in tabletop mode by placing your phone flat on a table. To finish the tutorial, swipe up with 3 fingers, and find the finish tutorial option
To move the cursor backward, swipe up. Try it now.
To change your language while typing with the braille keyboard, swipe up with 3 fingers. Then select \"switch to next language\".
Quickly change language while typing
Switched to %s
Screen-away mode
Tabletop mode. Place your device with the charging port to the left. To update dot position, hold down 6 fingers.
Turn on in accessibility settings
Turn on TalkBack to use braille keyboard
When TalkBack is on, you can tap your screen to enter braille symbols.
Resume TalkBack to use braille keyboard
Double tap anywhere to continue
Include all pressed dots
Reverse dots

With the braille keyboard, you can tap your screen to enter 6-dot braille.

You’re using Unified English Braille. To switch your typing language, go to TalkBack settings.

To type braille, you need to hold and use your phone differently.

Keep the screen faced away from you. Hold your phone in both hands, on the short edges of the phone, so that the middle 3 fingers of each hand can touch the screen.\n\nYour left index finger should be on dot 1. Now, tap dot 1 to type the letter “A”.
Tap dot 1 with your left index finger to type “A”
Tap %1$s to type the letter %2$s
Typing languages
Settings

1. Turn on braille keyboard: Tap Settings below. On the next screen, turn on \"%1$s.\"

2. Use braille keyboard: Open your regular keyboard, then tap the choose keyboard icon %2$s (usually in the bottom right corner). Select \"%1$s.\"

If you don’t see an option to switch keyboards, try installing %3$s, the Google keyboard.

To use the braille keyboard, open your regular keyboard, then tap the choose keyboard icon %1$s (usually in the bottom right corner). Select \"%2$s.\"

If you don’t see an option to switch keyboards, try installing %3$s, the Google keyboard.
